title: Two times room cleaning and lovely bathroom amenities
desc: Had a great stay at Regent Singapore. The breakfast spread is amazing with lots of options and Indian food as well. Manhattan bar is super! Loccitane amenities in the bathroom were an added bonus. Worth a visit

title: Great classic with good access to the posh end of Orchard Road
desc: We were most appreciative of a hotel that could confirm availability of accessible rooms prior to arrival/check-in. A gem that has lasted decades, located at a safe area off Orchard Road that is conveniently located near greenery (near Botanic Gardens) and classy western restaurants at Dempsey Hill and other establishments within walking distance at the posh end of Orchard Road. Great service - courteous and efficient. Parking is complimentary for our hired car and with easy egress and ingress. Loved the pool, gym and sauna - and had very memorable food and drinks by the pool - exceptional service with well trained staff. The weekend high tea looks like a classy British affair, but we couldn't indulge as one amongst us is gluten-intolerant. Will likely be back on another trip

title: The Luxury of Regent Singapore is best experienced with your loved ones
desc: The hotel has one of the best luxury, comfortable bed around in Singapore. The room was very well-maintained though this hotel has been in Singapore for years. The restaurant especially Basilico (one of the best we have ever seen) serve some of the best food under Michelin recommended guide that we have our dinner there.

title: Beautiful hotel, wonderful stay
desc: Loved the stay! Beautiful property, great food. Enjoyed the buffet spread. A lot of variety - food and drinks. The rooms are beautiful, clean, spacious, comfortable. Service was great. The rooms were cleaned daily and everything refilled timely. Good gym and a clean swimming pool. I didn't face any problems during my stay. Thanks for the wonderful experience

title: Excellent place to stay
desc: This is an excellent place to stay, in the city center. Short drives/walking distance from many attractions. Nice reception and good interiors. The rooms are good, well designed and spacious. The best part is the complementary mobile phone in the Room, which you can carry with you while roaming in the city and can make and receive free calls to local and many countries. So no worries, if you are having a phone and worried about international roaming charges. I stayed in this hotel twice and had an excellent experience. The breakfast is Asian / Continental with little choice of South Indian dishes as well. Overall excellent experience and would love to go back.

title: Great location, Great food
desc: Rooms: the rooms are a little dingy. The limited lights in the room, make the room very dull & dark. The view from the rooms is also very ordinary. Food: the food spread for any of the meals - breakfast, lunch, dinner, is extraordinary. the number of options, and variety on offer, makes it worth every penny spent. Location: Located on Orchard road, it is in the heart of the shopping district. It is walking distance from the Orchid Gardens, and numerable malls. The bus stop & metro station are also close by, making it very convenient to travel from the hotel. Wow factor: The hotel provides a complimentary android phone that can be used to make & receive calls, navigation, etc, thereby solving the issue of connectivity for an international traveller

title: Classic 5 Star
desc: Good stay at this hotel in Singapore. A classic 5 star Singapore hotel, that has been around for a long time. Staff good and generally helpful. Beds are not the most comfortable, but like the large rooms, plenty of space. Bathrooms are old style. Unfortunately not close to transport or main areas. But ok if you want to taxi everywhere.

title: 1st Class
desc: Really loved this hotel. The room, staff and facilities were fantastic. The breakfast was great. It's in good location and the facility is really beautiful. One of my favorites was the hotel lends you a smart phone to use in the city, which was really handy!

title: Beautiful luxury hotel in Orchard Rd area
desc: The Regent may not be The Four Seasons but is by The Four Seasons and it shows. Luxurious interior design, friendly staff and service. It is also ideally located just off Orchard Rd, and I would highly recommend it for business stay.

title: Excellent business hotel
desc: Regent is an excellent hotel for business with handy phone provided, which allows you to make unlimited international calls to some countries and mobile data anywhere in Singapore. Friendly staff, good location and services. It is a traditional hotel not modern, but everything is fine for business trip. It was also lucky that my room was being updated to suite. Appreciated with that. Thank you, Regent

title: Completely comfortable and wonderful staff
desc: Staff got to know us calling us by name at restaurants. Breakfast and lunch buffets are outstanding. Walk to Orchard Road shopping in five minutes so location is great. Room was comfortable and quiet. Executive floor snacks are good too. Would happily stay here again.

title: Very good hotel in quiet location
desc: Although I have visited many Singapore hotels in my years as a resident, I have only stayed overnight at a few. Several colleagues mentioned that the Regent was often very well priced and comfortable so I gave it a try when I needed a room. I found it to be a very comfortable hotel with very competitive pricing given its offerings. It is just a short stroll to Tanglin shops and a little further to the end of Orchard Road with the newer, "tonier" Malls/shops. Rooms are comfortable and well designed, and the location is relatively quiet. Service was very good. Basilissimo, the Italian restaurant, is an attractive, quiet comfortable restaurant offering great entree and dessert buffet with limited selection of mains from the menu. There are also a good Cantonese restaurant as

title: One of my favourite stays ....
desc: I previously stayed at a former Regent hotel in Turks & Caicos and had a great time. When Regent popped up in my search results in Singapore, I had to go for it, especially being a Four Seasons hotel on top of that. Told the checkin, it was for my wife's birthday, we are visiting South East Asia and this is the 5th country on our list. The birthday actually falls during our stay at Singapore. The day of checkin was my wife's birthday, the checkin attendant noticed it when looking at our ID. I asked if possible to do something special and she mentioned she will take care of it. At checkin, I paid extra to get the club lounge access and dedicated rooms. The price was worth it, if you were doing breakfast at the hotel. It was almost the same, and you get break fast

title: Back again
desc: We have now been staying at The Regent each year since 2013 en route to NZ. Our opinion has not changed in that the service is excellent from the welcome from the doormen, check in staff, cleaners, restaurant staff, etc. How many of them remember our names each time is quite marvellous. We stay in the Executive rooms, as the benefits of a relaxing place for breakfast, afternoon tea, happy hour drinks in the evening, and excellent hot and cold snacks, plus wonderful service from the staff, make the extra cost well worth it. We stayed 3x2 nights. On the way out from the UK; back from NZ, and then a short break over to Langkawi before home again. They stored a suitcase for us without any problem. On one of the occasions we did notice our room smelt very damp - a different

title: Good business hotel
desc: Stayed here for a week for a business trip. The staff are very friendly and attentive, and always willing to help out with little questions. The complementary smart phones are a great idea; free calls back home made a real difference for me. A stand out is the Manhattan Bar, which was superb (if very pricey, but then what isn't in Singapore). Breakfast in the restaurant was an outstanding spread. Although not Downtown, the location is great; only a few minutes walk to the top of Orchard Road, and about 100 metres from Tanglin Mall. I'll definitely use this hotel again.

title: the best place !!!!!!!!!!!
desc: I have been in this hotel with my wife at February 2017. It’s in a very good spot, very clean and has large and perfect rooms! The staff were very polite,helpful and every time we needed something they responded quickly with a smile on their face. Τhe breakfast was amazing and served in a very nice surrounding !!

title: Comfortable place to stay in a good location
desc: We had a 24 hour layover in Singapore and stayed at the Regent Singapore. It was clean and comfy and had great proximity to Orchard Road, Tanglin Mall, and the Botanical Gardens. I would stay here again for sure. It was a bit expensive for our purposes (arrived at 10pm and had to check out at 11am) but that was my bad.

title: Wonderful Service!
desc: All the personnel at the hotel were helpful & spoke beautiful English. The rooms were spacious with all amenities. Common areas were beautiful with lots of seating. Location was convenient and would definitely recommend.

title: Excellent stay
desc: I stayed here two nights 3/4 Feb 2017. Check in was efficient and friendly, which was nice after over 20 hours of travelling. I warned them that my friend would be joining me much later and when he arrived it was no problem to sort out his key. We were in the room 10 minutes after we both arrived. The room was large enough and the bed very comfortable. Two hard pillows were provided for each person. A large screen tv with a lot of channels was provided, but oddly, no BBC World News channel, just the UK domestic Sky News. The wifi was easy to connect, with up to four devices per room. My friend was unable to connect at all, but we think this was a problem with his device. One nice touch, was the provision of a Samsung smart phone. We took this with us on out day out

title: Excellent in all aspects!
desc: A 4-day R&R after a week of Medical Mission (Surigao,Philippines) at Regents has been the best hotel experience I have ever had. The bed was the best bed I've ever slept in. Also, being addressed by your name even only after 1st meeting with staff in any department (Lobby, Restaurant, etc.) sure made one feel important; not just a customer. I even wrote a letter to Regent's President, CEO, COO expressing the best customer service rendered by their staff. Service received can't compare with ANY US luxury hotel accommodations. I'll definitely would stay there again.

title: Adequate large hotel, showing its age
desc: We had a pleasant room for our two-night stay, which was serviced very well. However, the hotel's furnishings are tired and the internal atrium which towers above the ground floor gives it an oppressive feel. Generally the public spaces are quite dark and gloomy. The sombre atmosphere was not improved whilst we were there by the dominance of large groups and cruise passengers. Although there are huge numbers of people to serve, breakfast was good and well organised, if hectic. Just having arrived, we visited the Italian restaurant. It was very expensive and we felt under-dressed. The swimming pool was disappointing. It is located at the back of the main restaurant and is quite small and overshadowed by tall buildings.

title: Business trip in Singapore
desc: The hotel is well located and in a walking distance to Orchard Road and close to shopping and business districts. The staff was very friendly and helpful. There is free mobile phone to use which includes 3G data and local/international calls. Endless Wi-Fi and bottled water provided. We would stay again.

title: The best customer service
desc: Thank you to all the staff at The Regent. You all provide exceptional excellent customer service. We had a seamless and very comfortable stay at your beautiful hotel during our honeymoon. The complimentary mobile phone with free local and international calls, texts and Internet was a cherry on top. Would highly recommend your hotel.

title: Good Location, Lovely Concierge Staff
desc: I was very pleased with the staff handling prior to checkin with assistance and guidance. Post checkin the Concierge desk was very helpful throughout our stay as well as the bellboys. The breakfast was lovely, especially the Oriental options. We enjoyed the welcome amenity in our room, very sweet of them to place for my Mother's 60th Birthday. I only wish the room was more lively although the bed was very comfortable. The bathrooms were neat and clean but could do with a face lift to make them bright as well. but if someone enjoys the old style interiors there is nothing you can falter here. Overall a lovely stay.

title: Old property, large rooms but very dated
desc: Received a complimentary suite upgrade at the hotel reception which is always very nice, but unfortunately the room was very dated and smelled funny. The pool area is also under average for a place like Singapore where you have amazing swimming pools on five star properties. The location of the hotel is nice because it is close enough to Orchard Road and at the same time the roads are not very busy with cars passing by. Despite the negatives the staff was impeccable and the room-service was also very decent.

title: Fantastic hotel
desc: Fantastic hotel, fantastic service, fantastic room with balcony, fantastic food at Basilico, fantastic bar Manhattan, fantastic tearoom. Thoroughly spoilt!! A week in this hotel was most enjoyable. We loved the location. It is very close to Orchard Road where all the major shopping malls are.

title: Perfect hotel for business or leisure
desc: The Regent, A Four Seasons hotel is very well located walking distance ,almost on Orchard Road and close to shopping and business districts. What I loved was the elegance of its public places and very friendly and helpful staff. The porch and front desk staff, concierge are always smiling and willing to help. The afternoon tea lounge is the best place to meet guests and enjoy their tea service. The Manhatran bar worked so well for us for after dinner drinks. The little details , the anti skid bathtubs, the branded toiletries, the Handy phone are what differentiates a good hotel. We stayed for a whole week and loved every bit .

title: Disappointed
desc: Great check in and room not too bad but things took a turn for the worse! Went for a relax at the pool (which is not easy to find) and although the attendant was very nice the pool area was very small, and right outside a restaurant, there was a loud noise and smell of food which was really off putting . Back in our room it was very noisy with sounds from the atrium and particularly from adjacent toilet flushing and showers. Breakfast however was excellent Well positioned for Orchard Road and an easy walk to the Botanic and Orchid Gardens

title: Just perfect - it comes with a free of charge mobile phone
desc: Rooms are furnished with large bed and sofa, TV flat screen is huge like at home, excellent working desk and endless WiFi (speedy). The breakfast is so diverse - the first day of leisure yesterday I took 2 hours, read the free newspaper, ate Dim Sum, fruit, fresh multigrain bread with cheeses, cold cuts, croissants and jam from Bonne Maman - always good and tasty. Fresh fruit juices. Excellent coffee. I enjoyed the swimming pool until it started to rain. I loved to stay here. The location is great - near to pedestrian walkway of Orchard Road to walk and also to sneak into the shopping malls. What I also discovered - in front of the door stops the airport bus. It takes one hour and for 2.50 SGD you get to the airport terminal you need to go. For an additional fee you can get

title: PSat its prime but don't give up on it
desc: We stayed here for 2 nights as part of a group booking and were impressed at the efficiency of reception with the group arriving en masse. The staff in all departments sennet attentive (beyond the usual for an institutional type establishment), breakfast superb, the Italian buffet dinner good if a bit pricey. The moan is that the Four Seasons seem probably to concentrate on their newer facility close by, the Regent needs a big make over as its tired and a bit gloomy looking, but that's no criticism of the staff or service. Very good pool and gym BUT the kitchen extractors discharge into the pool area: there are better ways of relaxing that to guess what the next meal is being prepared. Well located.

title: A Great vacation stay at the Regent
desc: We had a great time at the Regent. I don't know why people complain about it looking dated. I think the place has quality and not modern cheap interior styling. I asked for a view if possible but I was told that there were really not good views as the hotel was 12 stories only, but I was given instead an upgrade(actually two upgrades) to a suite. What a nice thing to do. I loved the suite and comforts provided. I used the complimentary Nespresso machine and decided to get one for my own. Everyone of the employees at the regent were friendly and helpful. Whatever we asked for we got with a smile. At the concierge, Christy and her team were especially kind and helpful. She made reservations for our tours and restaurants, with confirmation on the phone in front of us and

title: Not up to Four Season's Standards
desc: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights as part of a cruise package. Overall, the (2nd room, after the first smelled musty) room was nice, though nothing up to the quality of other Four Season's managed properties I have stayed at before. In particular, we had a dinner in the Korean restaurant on the property (the food was good), and were shocked by the state of the restaurant...simply put, "autopsy room lighting", very dated decor, and a generally unkempt appearance. Perhaps the real Four Season's around the corner, or the St Regis around the other corner would better suit someone looking for 5 star quality.

title: Really nice hotel at a reasonable price
desc: Booked trough Expedia and got a really good rate here. The hotel is very nice in the public areas with comfy sofas and a nice clubby bar. It has good restaurants too. Rooms are functional and I got upgraded to a suite which was nice. It's a little faded but I like that as it adds to the charm. Stayed two nights and was very happy with the whole experience.

title: Excellent Service & Staff
desc: I can't recommend this hotel enough. The location is great, the hotel is beautiful and the staff proved to be thoughtful and professional. From the Front Desk Manager Brandon to Carmella at the Regent Club, you are in great hands. I absolutely recommend this hotel. Added bonus - Rooms come equipped with a HANDY smartphone to use while visiting so you really don't need to add an international plan if you're coming from the U.S. The phone allows you to make local and international calls, use Google Maps, research restaurants and posting on social media free of charge. I also recommend upgrading to add excess to the Regent Club. It's an great place to relax in between meetings, sightseeing or shopping. Thank you Regent Hotel Singapore. I look forward to visiting again.

title: Excellent hotel and location
desc: Really good hotel, not as shiny as many of Singapore's 5 star places but excellent value, great staff, nice room. A great benefit was the free hand phone for all local and International calls to various countries including the UK and data which you could use outside the hotel. Free parking. Great little gym. Would definitely stay here again if the rate is still as good as it was.

title: Great Hotel high class - perhaps not if you have a fear of heights
desc: Impressive foyer and staff were very friendly and helpful. Stayed in garden view room on tenth floor, large size with good quality bed and linen. Free mobile phone to use which includes 3G data and local/international calls. Although very stylish bathroom was a little small with shower curtain. Great location with shopping centre next door with great variety of shops including supermarket. Dining a little expensive so we went next door to Hotel Jen. Endless Wi-Fi and bottled water provided. We would stay again. Elevator is in middle of hotel to get to room is across a walk across a connecting path, as the hotel is built around a built around atrium. This is very impressive but not good for anyone who has Acrophobia. Carpets require urgent updating through-out.

title: Very welcoming
desc: So I'll start with the single negative point. The rooms are a little tired. They are not terrible but you would want a little more from a Four Seasons property. Everything else was amazing. The service really is second to none. The staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome and truth be told I would return based on the service alone.

title: Oasis of calm in a vibrant city
desc: We would like to thank the Regent Hotel and their wonderful staff for ensuring that our recent holiday was perfect, beginning with a warm welcome from the smiling doormen upon arrival to our departure ten days later. The rooms were large and comfortable, restaurants varied and we particularly loved the coffee/shop bakery offering both savoury and sweet treats plus great coffee and an exotic cocktail at Manhattan was always a lovely end to the day. The Handee phone was incredibly useful and the concierge a great source of information and tips for travel / shopping / activities and always happy to assist. Position was perfect, taxis at the door, a bus from the front of the hotel and a short stroll to Orchard Road and the rail.

title: website and no show charge
desc: due to an error on arrival date from poor website interface they charged me a no show rate, no prior warning of impending stay they did not want to discuss or deal with the issue at all, very poor for a hotel in the hospitality industry

title: Superb location
desc: From an airline crew's point of view, the hotel is superbly located. Just off Orchard rd on a quiet street, its restful with an added 5* for service (with the exception of a sulky receptionist in charge of airline crew check-in). A special feature which is such a blessing, is a handyphone which u can carry all around the city and even make free int'l calls (to specific countries). The food is amazing served by the friendliest room service staff I've seen in my 27 years with my airline. Even the laundry delivery staff is well trained in PR!! The rooms are spacious and modern and the bathrooms, luxurious. Keep up the good work Regent!

title: Excellent in every way
desc: Stayed four days at this hotel I thoroughly enjoyed my stay its location is in a quite area within a short walk to Orchard Road? I would recommend the club rooms it is well worth the extra money given the free breakfast, free happy two hour and evening snacks The service is great without being intrusive

title: Have you stayed at the Regent Singapore?
desc: If you have not, you must try it! Highly recommended. Their service is impeccable. We stayed there for four nights. Went away a couple of days. Then come back again for another week. It was lovely. It feels so homely! We had a suite the whole time. The upgrade is really worth it. There is more room for the whole family. It is clean. The turndown service is always prompt. And they are available even when we call them back late because we had accidentally left the Do Not Disturb sign on the whole evening. They will vacuum upon request as well. They do everything cheerfully and courteously! They are awesome! The bellhop people are very friendly and strong and helpful. The concierge even has a bottle of water available when I requested of her. I just cannot fault them for

title: Decent hotel in good location!
desc: I stayed at the Regent for two nights as part of a business trip. The hotel is well located and a good example of its type. Facilities are good with several internal restaurant choices (Italian, Chinese) and room service was good. The breakfast was comprehensive and the room excellent with the exception of a very hard bed. Normally I don't mention beds specifically as it's a very personal perception, but this one was like a piece of slate!

title: Family Holiday
desc: We went to this hotel 12th Feb 2017 and found this one of the best hotels we stayed in. The hotel staff was very friendly, helpful and customer focussed. They e mailed us a few days before arrival and asked if we were celebrating any special occasion n asked for flight times. I told them we were celebrating our kids birthday & land midday. The hotel staff went the extra mile to make the day special for the kids... they decorated the room with Birthday banner n balloons. Their chef made an extremely tasty chocolate cake. They also were very considerate and without us even asking they prepared the room before our arrival. Their hotel policy clearly states that check in is after 3pm but as they knew our flight time they were very kind to let us check in at 1pm with the room

title: Excellent business hotel
desc: Modern with all facilities you need. Staff is friendly and excellent; go out of their way to help. Taxis always available at the front. Botanical Gardens a 10 minute walk away; handy for an early morning scenic run. Breakfast is a good spread.

title: Courtesy local mobile phone is a great idea
desc: This is an excellent hotel located 5-10 minutes walk from Orchard road, everything you would expect from a four seasons property. The courtesy mobile phone had gps and allowed you to book local attractions.

title: Wonderful stay
desc: Spent 5 nights at The Regent hotel and loved our stay - not one complaint which is so rare ! Our room was a great size and loved the plug points in bedside draw. Convenient location and hotel has a lovely bar and great restaurant .

title: Lunch
desc: BUFFET lunch. Fabulous selection and good staff. Excellent respinse to a dufficulty with a rogue ant. No complaintsxat all. Beef Lamb cooked to orrfection. Fabulous deserts anfsalads. Cheeses and accompaniments.

title: My first experience in Regent Singapore, A Four Seasons Hotel
desc: The hotel is grand and nice with polite and helpful staff. The room is clean, quiet and comfy. The purpose of visiting Singapore is to celebrate my birthday with my friends. I felt so glad and warm that Mr Tham TW, the hotel assistant manager, was so considerate that having known our purpose, he prepared a nice delicious birthday cake and a bottle of wine for us to celebrate at that very late night when we returned to the hotel. I would also like to thank Ms Esther Lee who patiently explained to me over the phone on my enquiries before my trip. The staff and the service of the hotel were so great that I enjoyed very much staying there.

title: Amazing birthday with Four Season
desc: First of all, I would like to say thank you to staffs for your great service and lovely treat during my stay. We got a double surprise for honeymoon and birthday surprise. We' re really relax in a cozy room and convenience location - just 3 minute to Mrt and ION Orchard. I was surprise for a birthday cake - so yummy one, flower, card, candle and 2 lovely balloon showing when I back to room in the evening. I really appreciated for your kind service. As well as the breakfast is amazing of variety, fresh and delicious - The bakery is a must !! The staffs are so helpful and details. Thank you so much and I hope to be back there soon. You made my day :) Siriya & Sittidet 25-27 March 2017

title: Great!!!
desc: Great hotel with city location. Feel like at home with warmth service from the staffs. It's walking distance from Orchad, so very close to shopping center. Even there's a bus stop right in front of the hotel.

title: Excellent hotel
desc: I stayed in the hotel for business reason in jennuary 2017. The hotel exceeds my expectative . The interior and exterior design was accurate and it create a luxury atmosphere. During my stay the hotel was performing same renewal activities and the noise in my room was really high but , once inform the reception , the staff moved me in a more quite room offering me a wine bottle to apologise. Very good the gym and the swimming pool! At basilico restaurant i was able to enjoy amazing breakfast and dinner ! I will choose again this hotel!

title: Excellent service in the heart of Singapore
desc: I stayed here on business and as I was experiencing some difficulty in walking, they opened a new check in for me so I don't have to wait too long during check in. The room was comfortable and wifi was good. Breakfast has good variety especially the noodle fishball soup. Overall, excellent service and highly recommended.

title: Excellent
desc: Excellent hotel, big and clean room (very good for families) and nice amenities, very good restaurants. Staff efficient and friendly. Have no complains at all. A true Four Seasons hotel. This was our first visit to Singapore and the fact that we got a good hotel during our stay there certainly helped us to form a good impression of the city.

title: Well priced premium hotel near Tanglin Mall
desc: This 5 star property is well priced and is located at one end of Orchard Road near Tanglin Mall — a short walk from Wheelock Place and ION. The atrium is airy, the buffet breakfast is good, rooms not too small. And each room has a smartphone for your use during your stay with free calling to about 10 countries. That was amazing.

title: Wonderful property!
desc: Wonderful property - pretty big [always got confused as to where the front desk was from the elevators :)] Restaurant was great - with a wide variety to choose from. In terms of room service, I wish housekeeping paid a little more attention to detail when it came to replenishing the toiletries in the bathroom or the coffee/ tea/ creamer. I am a little finicky when I realize that after boiling the kettle to make coffee that there is no creamer in the coffee/ tea supplies. But overall, nice property and nice staff.

title: Was top rated hotel by Conde Nast in 2015 ... not surprising in the least, well deserved
desc: Truly a first class experience away from the craziness/crowds of the insanely over-priced marina hotels. We had a club level room with access to the private lounge. It's breakfast, while not huge, was fresh and of high quality. We loved the fresh squeezed juices! The "happy hour" was icing on the cake. The Concierge helped us with getting around. The location was perfect as well, close to shopping and sights. In a city packed with premium hotels, I'd -never- stay at any of them over the Regent. Having been in so many other hotels in Singapore, I'd go so far to say that this is really the only hotel there that really feels like you belong there. This is a special place. The longer you are in Singapore, the more you'll understand why ... don't miss it.

title: Quality hotel, slightly dated but still excellent
desc: Location : The hotel is very well located and within a few minutes walk to Orchard road. Next door is a small shopping complex which has everything you might need like Brunettis coffee shop (one of the best coffee and cake shops from Melbourne) yummmmm, chemists and an excellent super market and many other novelty shops. Rooms : spacious with a massive King bed. You can tell the mattress is of superb quality (on the very firm side, just the way I love it). The bed linen and pillows are also excellent quality (very important to me). They give you FREE unlimited international phone calls to 10 specified countries which is very generous. Air conditioning is very efficient and cooling. Bathtroom : adequately size and very clean with excellent amenities (Locitane). Huge Towels super

title: the best service in singapore
desc: I have stayed on the club floor at the Regent singapore many times over the past ten years and it never ceases to amaze me the high level of service they offer to their guests. From general tourist information to that nice red wine you like, never a problem. When the same staff stay with a hotel for many years you know that as they are being looked after by their employer, they will in turn look after their guests. Travelling worldwide and staying at world class hotels, Regent singapore is in my opinion , the best service in asia!!!!!!!

title: Nice but dated
desc: It is quietly located away from the busy Orchard central. But you get some decent eateries and the bus stops in front. It seems to be a favorite hotel for the Japs. Most people like it and they recommended me to stay here. But I prefer a newer, modern finishing in my room like separate rain shower from the tub and this doesnt have it. But the room is very well stocked with everything a traveller needs. Staff are all very polite and helpful. I like that it has built in universal adapter and there are more than enough power sockets. But this isn't a place to stay if you want to shop. You certainly won't get loud Chinese tourists here.

title: Quality hotel, dated, but a 3-am loud party busted our visit.
desc: We took the reviews from both TripAdvisor and another 'Hotels' site, liked the location and 'breakfast' rave reviews. We stayed on the Regent Executive Lounge floor, and found the early-evening hors d'oeuvres more than ample for an evening meal, with a free flow of wines, beers and champagne. The 'downer' was the party on the first floor foyer area that blasted throughout the entire 12-floor hotel til almost 3 a.m. Management was contacted several times, and they did not respond. So, what was planned as a quiet getaway to celebrate with my wife was a wasted first night. We almost checked-out, except we knew that any cancellation would result in full-payment (no credit or refunds).

title: Excellent for business visitors
desc: A quiet place so near to the Orchard Road, is a blessing. It has a good choice of restaurants nearby and you can simply walk across. The breakfast at Restaurant Basilico was very good, with so many choices. The Noodle Soup was excellent. Good rooms, well provided, well furnished. What I liked specially was the placement of the lifts in the centre of the lobby, with a good view all around. The Tanglin Mall is next door.. Wouldn't mind staying here again.

title: GREAT HOTEL AND STAFF
desc: My daughter and I went to Singapore for 10 days and stayed at the Regent (Four Seasons Hotel) and found it absolutely wonderful. There were two weddings whilst there and it was a very expensive one judging on the cars the guests arrived in - 4 Lamborghini, two Rolls Royce and several Mercedes top line cars. The staff and food were absolutely excellent and the rooms were clean and done every day as was the bathrooms. We would certainly stay there again as it was a wonderful experience and close to everything. It certainly didn't cost us an arm and a leg as we don't have that much money. This was a special trip for my daughter's 50th birthday.

title: A great welcome after a long journey
desc: The hotel is absolutely beautiful and the staff have such a wonderful can do attitude and nothing was too much trouble,they went to great lengths to make us very comfortable. They also have the "Regent Club" which is an area for guests to just relax grab a light snack and a beverage / drink during "down" time, maybe after returning from visiting local attractions, an aperitif before going out or before leaving for the airport. I cannot stress strongly enough how focused the staff are this is one of the best examples of customer service that I have ever encountered and during our stay there were three very high profile weddings (judging by the appearance and size of the groups) but the rest of the hotel was not disadvantaged by this.

title: Luxury Oasis close to Botanical gardens and Orchard Rd
desc: So happy we chose this lovely hotel for our 3 day visit to Singapore! The staff were wonderful, our room clean, food excellent. We stayed in the club room (with lounge priveleges)which served breakfast, afternoon tea and hors d'oeuvres in the evening. The hotel provided a Handi phone to call home to Canada. We enjoyed the serene atmosphere and beauty of the public spaces. We will return!

title: Hotel needs to be refurbished desperately
desc: We stayed here as a stopover on the way home from the Maldives. I had advised the staff when booking that we would arrive very early in the morning and we booked an extra half day for late check out for our return, didn't want to take the chance and have to hang around too long. We arrived to be told no room available, later to find out that the hotel was very quiet. The young man at reception was very nice and eventually called us to say a room was ready. We checked in to discover our city view room that looked so great on net was the roof of the pub next door, disappointed but what can you do. Tired, I went to have a bath, I thought they were hairs in the bottom of the bath but they turned out to be gouges in the enamel, tap ware stained and dirty , bathroom old , outdated

title: Great hotel
desc: This is a wow hotel without any doubts. Its location is at a walking distance from Orchid Rd and a MRT. When we first arrived the desk manager was very nice and cooperative, he showed me the installations by himself. Into the hotel there is a best bar in Singapore and ranked 3rd in the world "Manhattan". The room was quiet clean and big, and everything worked perfect. We received an android mobile free of charge with 3G inside for our personal use during our stay !! Well done

title: Wonderful hotel near Orchard
desc: Stay for 5 days and 4 night. Everything was perfect First, we arrived the hotel by taxi, which the hotel staff was well prepared to greet us and take the luggages. We arrived around an hour before our check-in time so the staff us ask to store the luggages. When I'm back I just come to reception to get my room key and the luggages was already place in our room. Moreover, they had fulfill our requested perfectly. Therefore, very please with the excellent service. After spending the whole day sightseeing, I was very pleased to come back and found the l'occitane bath set amenities. This really had fulfill my relax night. This really give me a key different from other 5 stars hotel I had stayed in Singapore. Love it!! This really make me want to come back to this hotel. The hotel

title: Could Use A Refresh
desc: I recently visited Singapore for three nights and opted to stay at the Regent - partially because I have stayed at Regent hotels in the past and have been happy with the amenities, and partially because of its proximity to Orchard Road and all that it has to offer. The room itself was good, not amazing - it was a bit outdated and could use a bit of a refresh. But the staff was quite friendly and helpful which made the difference!

title: Perfect hotel for a short break
desc: The Regent hotel is grand and beautiful inside. The lobby area is very spacious with a lovely scent of fresh flowers. After a 13 hour flight, the Checkin process was quick and easy and our bags were sent to our room instantly without having to wait around. The room itself was bigger than expected with our own sofa and table area, large bed and spacious bathroom. It was kept clean on a daily basis with all facilities included. House keeping were fantastic and always catered for our needs. The location of the hotel is in a quieter area off the main road "Orchard Road" which we loved as we preferred to be away from any traffic. The hotel is a 15 min walk to the nearest MRT which isn't too bad at all, located on Orchard road which also had all the shops and malls - very

title: The best even got better
desc: We previously considered the Regent Hotel in Singapore to be one of the best we had ever visited but our recent stay there surpassed even that assessment. From the amazing welcome, where the front desk rep came out to our car (which had been booked from the airport) and greeted us by name and just took us to the room to check us in without even filling in any forms right to all the staff who treated us with kindness, respect and comfort as though we were family members. The room, an executive suite , was large and well appointed and as we stayed more than four nights, we had access to the Regent Club lounge. That was a delight in itself. Room service was quick and delicious. Perhaps the dinner in the main restaurant Basilicos was rather overpriced but given the cost of

title: Quiet hotel away from the main action in Singapore
desc: never much bad to say about a Four Seasons' property, but this hotel was not quite up to the level of others in the chain. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. The lobby was nice but the interior design of hotel left a little to be desired. There is a more traditional Four Seasons hotel nearby, so perhaps that one is more what I expected. The pool area was small but adequate and the service was very good.

title: Class & Comfort at The Regent
desc: The best customer service I have received in over 30 years of traveling. Most desirable breakfast with many choices to suit different palates and served by attentive staff. Biggest bed I have slept in, firm with crisp fresh cotton sheets. Excellent room service when needed. I will be returning when the next opportunity arises.

title: Ian h
desc: Absolutely beautiful-staff are amazing and nothing too much trouble,especially on the executive floor. Buffet breakfast fantastic but exec level a little bit of a let down at breakfast. Would recommend to anyone happily and will come back

title: Gem of a Hotel !
desc: Stayed twice recently and based on the quality of the original stay I also chose it for a second stay with colleagues in mid May. I First stayed in April for a night, and the Hotel Reception and Greeting on arrival was both warm and welcoming....at that point while the Hotel is a classic and mature offering in Singapore I realised then and there that the service would really set the place above the rest. While my original room location was a bit odd, (in my mind) my request for a change of location even quite late at night was met with superb efficiency and care. To my complete surprise I was upgraded to a Suite. Needless to say, very happy and the Suite was both very comfortable and well appointed. A recent second stay was just a good, while in a regular room it was still very

title: Lovely weekday afternoon tea!
desc: Excellent food and service! Thanks to Mark, Sheila, Jennifer and Alice! Recommended to me by a friend who used to live here, I chose the Tea Lounge at the Regent because it was not a buffet style-I wanted to sit down and relax during our tea. The hotel lobby was beautiful, quiet and comfortable. Mark was kind enough to let me sit at our reserved table even though I arrived early. He brought a case with tea leaf samples along with a menu for me to leisurely choose our teas for the afternoon (I liked the aroma of Imperial Earl Grey). The finger sandwiches and pastries and sweets were all delicious, especially the freshly baked scones! Sheila (who brought me a light blanket when I asked for one), Jennifer and Alice were all very cheerful and constantly made sure our cups

title: Well rounded staycation
desc: Had a 1 day stay only this time round at Regent Hotel. This is not the first time spending my weekend with them, had booked the weekend renewal package. The few reasons which entice me to return as follow: 1. guaranteed late check out 4pm. - it would be good is able to extend it up to 6pm, similar to 'Far More Singapore' package offered by Far East Hospitality. 2. warm hospitality received from front desk staff, Stella Kung. Had requested the room AC temp to be lowered as temp in all rooms are locked and Stella even followed up with me after the technicians have fixed it to ensure that the room feels comfortable. Would be better if the individual AC control can adjust the temp. freely, rather than having to call in for technicians. 3. Quality ensured breakfast at Basilico

title: Great stay
desc: Have travelled to Singapore regularly and this recent visit decided to stay somewhere different so selected the Regent. We received exceptional service from all staff, particularly from Liming who was Manager of the Regent Club on level 11 who was excellent (Liming has since moved to Concierge). Also extremely attentive service at the pool, well done. We chose a club room for the opportunity to utilise the argent Club for breakfast and evening cocktails and horsedouvres (actually more of a meal!) The room was excellent, a very decent size and very comfortable (only complaint was a smell of cigarette smoke whenever we arrived back from a day out?) Breakfast in the club, though private, is very limited in comparison to that on offer in Basilico which is to be expected due to size

title: Basillico lady's night = happy night
desc: 3rd visit. Food and service awesome We took the free flow Prosecco dinner and was well supported by friendly attentive service staff The Buffet bar was nice but more fresh variety or fruits would hv been better. Almost everything is salted and I was hoping to see more soft cheese like Brie etc. Because everything was too savoury I didn't enjoy towards the end of my meal n ended up drinking lots of water But the wine n service kept me happy

title: Regent Recommendation
desc: Such courteous and cheerful staff make the lovely Regent Hotel on Cuscaden Road a wonderful place to stay. Try the cakes and coffee and walk off the calories down Orchard Road or stroll to the Botanical Gardens. The Ion Mall is a 15 minute walk or take a taxi from the Hotel to the fabulous Gardens on the Bay. I spent 5 days there in May and would definitely return: a luxurious feel and nothing is too much trouble for the charming staff. Perhaps the rooms are getting a little dated but they are large, comfortable and clean. It has a compact outdoor pool and gym too!

title: FS Baby Sister
desc: The hotel is located slightly off the shopping area of Orchard street in a much quieter location closer to Tanglin. Upon entering the lobby, we had a feeling of a classical American style with some oriental touches with warm yet dark colors dominating the atrium. The bellboy took us to the room and introduced to all essential services and amenities. The room itself was of decent size with a bed, small lounge area and work desk - more than enough space. There was an interactive phone that can be used for various purposes like making free international calls in certain countries, concierge services, etc. Bathrooms had bathtubs instead of showers and bath amenities were provided by L'Occitane. The lights in the bathroom were slightly dimmer than expected and the ventilation did not

title: Refined & Comfortable
desc: A very well managed and run hotel Very well placed not in the noise but just 10m peaceful walk to the orchard street A small but nice pool The rooms are very comfortable and amenities worth appreciating The refinement of service is worth the mention The breakfast is the greatest plus , a lovely balanced true breakfast , keep it like that If I return will return for it An excellent understanding of stat comfort of the guest A backend taken care of thing that many time you don't need to ask for it again , that is worth appreciating Now the lows - This is something with many city hotels I have experienced , coziness of human kind is lacking , you absolutely don't need a hug , but the comfort vibrations are very much required for you to feel like a guest - The bell staff

title: Great hotel and good location!
desc: The five star hotel is located on Orchard Rd. and the bus stop is just in front of it. We can easily get a bus from the airport to the hotel. 10 minutes walk to the nearest MRT is very convenient! The hotel condition is a bit old as it has been opened for a long time but the facilities, staff and service are totally awesome! Highly recommend!

title: Excellent
desc: The staff were the stand out at this hotel. All were polite, delightful and helpful. Attention to detail was a constant too. I would gladly return yo this hotel. The location was good, just off Orchard Road.

title: Here for wedding dinner
desc: Rating: Good Visited the hotel for a friend’s wedding on 24/9. First of all I would like to commend - most of the dishes were delicious! My favourites include ee fu noodles, fish, broccoli. However, the first dish - the suckling pig tasted cold. Last dish (yam) - too sweet. The hotel location was rather hard to find - it’s about 15mins walk from train station. Take taxi would be a better choice. The interior of the hotel was well-maintained and it felt cosy. Next, the waiters and waitresses for the banquet is the main issue for most guests like me. The server(s) at my table had to interrupt my friend and I (all the time) when we were having a chat, there were so many vacant space around the table! Some of them spilled some of the dishes when trying to serve the food. They

title: Nice we like
desc: lovely hotel and clean rooms making the desire to stay in the room for long time the food was very tasty my husband and I are very happy stay at this place you must come and feel the amazing experience ... Thanks .

title: Business Trip - Sept 2017
desc: Good hotel in a great location. Lot's of retail stores and restaurants in walking distance. Breakfast is fantastic. Nice little bakery near hotel lobby. Hotel rooms need some updating and repairs completed. Bathroom had black mold due to water damage that was partially repaired. Expected more...

title: Still my favourite hotel in Singapore
desc: I've now stayed at the Regent three times, and my two most recent stays in August and September were both as excellent as the first one last year. The staff throughout the hotel made all the difference. There wasn't the stiff, dull, formality and inflexibility that I've seen at some other 5-star places. Like their colleagues at the Four Seasons around the corner, they managed to be professional and polite, while also being very friendly. They seemed to genuinely want to be helpful. The result was that it felt like everyone - staff and other guests - were happy to be there, which made for a relaxed, comfortable vibe. Kitchen and service staff and food at the Basilico restaurant were phenomenal as always. Room service was consistently very good (and staff were understanding of

title: A good night's rest
desc: This is a well situated and nicely staffed five-star hotel. Check-in and -out was straightforward, with no fuss. I found my room comfortable, but a bit musty - in that way that Southeast Asia high humidity can create. I had dinner with guests in the main restaurant, which was okay. The center elevators create some minor confusing when exiting, as the lobby exits are indistinguishable, and one has a similar experience on the upper floors (which are also not great for those with even minor vertigo, as a short railing separates pedestrians from a dizzying drop below to the main floor).

title: Amazing experience
desc: Love this hotel, the service was fantastic and quick, room has a great space and classic design. The breakfast was fantastic as well, on the evening they also served wine and many selections of light dishes. The restaurant has cozy ambience and beautiful interior. Thank you for having me, will be back!

title: Fantastic breakfast
desc: We stayed at the Regent only for a week; and we didn‘t want to leave. Exceptionally good service who tend to all your special requests to make your stay unforgettable. The breakfast buffet is out of this world with Asian as well as international cuisine.

title: Almost there
desc: Impressive building, impressive common areas, unfortunately falls way short when it comes to the rooms. Our Deluxe Room, City View was very disappointing for a hotel of Regent's stature. Outdated, very smelly, neglected, are terms that come to mind. The bathroom was about 30 years overdue for renovation, so tiny I couldn't swing a cat. tea & coffee facilities were provided in meager quantities to the point where I'd have to say "why bother". Also no milk to speak of. To summarize; very excited as we walked through the foyer areas to see our room, once the door was opened, our hearts sank. Needs improvement!

title: Food-cation
desc: We recently booked a stay at the Regent with their Foodie Staycation package. Considering our appetite for good food and good drinks (especially!), we left contented and were never left wanting. We started with a coffee at Dolcetto - quality true to its Italian roots. I had pre-ordered Dolcetto's Pistachio Creme Sphere as well given their limited quantities, which I genuinely enjoyed even for someone who does not have a sweet tooth (see pictures - it's a beauty too!!). This was followed with freshly made juices by the poolside and dinner at Summer Palace. And finally, we washed down dinner with drinks at the Manhattan and couldn't resist adding on Manhattan's steak pairing with our cocktails. (Tip: Summer Palace's Spinach and Crab Meat Broth was so light, clean, and the meat

title: Enjoyable Hotel stay
desc: Had a very smooth check in, staff were well trained and friendly. Rooms were superb with very strong wifi provided. 2 rounds of housekeeping 1 in the day another in the evening to check on any top up required. Excellent Hotel!

title: a top notch service
desc: I spent four nights in the regent hotel. The whole experience for me was unforgettable. It started with the stylish reception area to the executive lounge to the room. The staff were so welcoming and so friendly. The food in the lounge was so lavishing and the staff there ( especially Azura and Kim) were so considerate and always checked on us. The location of the hotel is strategic near all attractions and with taxis waiting outside. Would definitely go back again. If you want to feel pampered and lavished, this is the hotel to stay in

title: Excellent quality at good value
desc: I stayed here for 3 nights recently. The Hotel is immaculately maintained, the staff is extremely helpful and tuned in to the needs of the guests. The breakfast at the Regent is exceptional and I've been fortunate to have stayed at a lot of hotels. It was a high quality breakfast with a wide variety of healthy choices including smoked salmon and wonderful pastries. It was very much in step with a US based Four Seasons Hotel with a practical and well equipped gym. I will definitely stay at this hotel again in Singapore. It is also well located right off Orchard Road with many great eateries withing walking distance and also within the Tanglin Mall. I would frame the hotel as follows: Excellent quality for good value with the breakfast included.

title: Incredible Service! Truly a memorable stay!
desc: We’ve probably stayed in hundreds of hotels all over the United States and the world at a variety of accommodation levels from the top to the bottom. This experience was one of the best ever at every level. To say that it was excellent would be a disservice to the people who made our stay so enjoyable. It was truly great. Staff. Overall, the staff was incredible. The concierge did a number of things for us from bookings and reservations to sending a gift to our friend. They were eager to help, thorough on their execution, and creative with their problem-solving. Diniy in particular went above and beyond. The staff at Basilico for breakfast was diligent, friendly, and provided excellent service. The room was attended to multiple times each day. Food. We had the breakfast

title: Relatively Better Quality
desc: I extended my stay in Singapore and moved from a different comparable hotel, and this one is overall better and I would select this one again. I agree it needs updating in some areas, the 3 sliding closet doors don't slide easily and confusing. The furniture is more traditional, and the toilet is a little too low for me. One lamp switch by the bed does not turn off, so I had to use the switch by the outlet. The tub drain plug is broken, so I had to remove it to take a shower. However, the bed is very comfortable, and the quality of the bed sheets is simply Superb! The toiletries are excellent, there is a plush bathmat, and nice slippers. The rooms are clean and quite, which is important to me. I am also able to get a nice Illy cappuccino and pastry in the lobby. The other

title: Great high tea - super service
desc: Had high tea one afternoon with the love of my life - the experience was memorable. The high tea comes with a selection of savory and sweets but the creme de la creme was the choice of dessert - I would strongly suggest the Golden Apple which is fashioned from caramelized sugar with delicious iced yuzi apple compote. You can wash this down with a selection of teas and coffee - the pour over coffee is one to try for serious coffee drinkers. Have to mentioned is the Tea Lounge Manager - John - he leads his team to provide great service and engages you in interesting discussions as he patiently prepares your pour over coffee. Storngly recommended if you have a free afternoon to spare and wish to indulge.

title: Hmmm 5 star??
desc: Having stayed at other 5 star hotels in Singapore, which were amazing, I thought our room here should have been better than it was. It was a bit dated with dreadful old net curtains. Not being picky, just honest. The staff on reception were very helpful and checking in was excellent, the bathroom was ok with good products. Bed very comfortable, but housekeeping had not bothered to check the tea making facilities and replace them after previous guests. There was no milk, no saucers and a couple of t bags, no coffee. The pool bar was good albeit very slow, and the restaurant Basilico excellent. (Manhattans bar is another matter) which was awful. Good location though and plenty of shops within walking distance.

title: Back to the Regent
desc: I used to stay at the Regent years ago and was interested to see how the old girl has aged. Very well I'd say. Always a well designed property, it was very well built using high grade fixtures and fittings as well as quality building materials. This means that the hotel doesn't feel dated, rather solid and substantial. Rooms and public areas are spotlessly clean. Staff are cool, friendly and effecient. You will not be disappointed if you stay at The Regent.

title: High tea
desc: Best high tea in Singapore! Great food at the high tea buffet. Bu as well as that it is very friendly service. We have tried lots of other high teas and this one is consistently better than any of the others.

title: Mr
desc: Service and housekeeping was excellent. Mr. Tuck Wah , the Assistant Guest Experience Manager was attentive and pleasant to talk to. The pizza at Basilico was fresh and delicious with Henry our waiter serving us attentively and graciously. I would recommend my friends to stay in The Regent Hotel , A Four Seasons Hotel Singapore the next time they visit Singapore.

title: Best Hotel
desc: You can not leave the Hotel unless you have to,In every respect everything was great.All of the Employees were in good quality specially who work in the pool and restaurant.The hotel is located in a best place and near to orchard and every public transportation.

title: Functional, well run hotel
desc: Decor is a little dated, but the staff are efficient and helpful. The food was good, if a little limited. I was happy to spend a few nights there with my family and would do so again. The concierge was excellent, as was the location.

title: Disappointed
desc: Stayed at Regent for one night and overall experience is disappointing at check in, room condition, and check out. Check in desk appeared to be helpful and offered a call upon room is ready but no call at all. At check out the staff has no interest to know if my staying is pleasant one. Most disturbing part was constant strange loud sound from somewhere water pipe throughout the night, smell from shower curtain. This hotel does not check room condition. It is definitely a rare experience in a five stars hotel in Asia. Don't think I would go back nor recommend this hotel to anyone I care. The only great experience is at Manhattan bar.

title: Superb!
desc: This hotel is all class. From the beautiful entry and foyer to the fantastically presented rooms. We recently traveled as a family (2 adults, 2 kids) and stayed in an executive suite. The room was very large, with a double sofa bed for the kids and a very comfortable main room for us adults. The hotel is located very conveniently near Orchard Rd and only a short taxi to Clarke Quay or other destinations. The welcome chocolates cookies and fruit were lovely.

title: Old school glamour and excellent service!
desc: As soon as I walk into the Regent hotel, I’m reminded of the times we used to travel here as kids, 25 years ago. It still looks the same and the service still hard to beat. It’s true that the hotel is a bit dated..... my room and the decor look very 80s but the entire place is clean and well kept. As soon as I walk in, the bell boy called me by my last name which is a bit surprising - how did they know? The reception was as friendly and knowledgeable and accommodating. First stop the Manhattan bar to meet a friend - the place is WOW. Sexy dark interiors with an amazing selection of cocktails. I came on a Thursday and I was at Manhattan 3 nights in a row. Once again the service is impeccable. The waitresses knew the ingredients to the cocktails they serve! It’s understandable

title: Great week at the Regent!
desc: Regent is a beautiful and posh hotel property and has a great location within walking distance of the main retail hub. Lounge and buffet services are premium class. Hotel staff is very polite and welcoming and go out of their way to provide a pleasant stay. Overall it's been a great week at Regent and a memorable experience!

title: hotel 5, Basilico restaurant 3
desc: Arrival: Smooth and easy Checkin very helpful Porter great Mobile phone in room awesome, you can take it out the hotel and use the internet and make both local and international calls for free. One bathroom had a faulty shower head but the other one was fine. Very hard to get the water temperature right, the response time on the taps is slow, this needs updating, perhaps a mixer would be a better option. Pool OK, service at the pool excellent Basilico – the one disappointment of the hotel. The food (when it arrived) was delicious but the service was awful. Adults meals arrived but no kids meals. After 5 full minutes waiting we ask where the kids food is. Literally 10 minutes later the kids food finally came out (by that stage the kids had eaten my wife's entire meal). Still

title: Helpful Staff, Best Service
desc: Overall, we had a great stay in the hotel. It is not new but it retains its grandness and tasteful ambience. The room we stayed in is big and faces a lot of greens. Since it is a 10-minute walk to Orchard, it is peaceful, restful and spares you the lights and the noise of Orchard. we all had a good sleep during the 5-day stay. I commend the Basilico staff, especially MOntecarlo and Justin. They are warm and kind. Calm and always smiling to their many guests. The lobby staff are not to be outdone though. We remember how patient "Joseph" was with all our queries about directions. The concierge was also commendable. Caught in the rain at almost midnight, using the hotel-provided smart phone, it led us to the next available taxi stand. Their service extends outside the hotel

title: Loved it
desc: Great location... friendly staff.. If I've to pick the most important part of the stay, my vote goes to awesome breakfast. A review will be incomplete without mentioning free cellphone for your use local sim and number, to call 10 destinations worldwide for free. This also includes free unlimited data and internet

title: A lovely stay
desc: A beautiful hotel, great space, lovely interiors. The staff was very polite and the service was quick. Buffet was very good. The rooms were spacious and very comfortable. Loved the stay here. Would definitely stay here again.

title: One of my most memorable stays
desc: Staying at the Regent is really an experience like no other. Their staff really go out of their way to make you feel pampered and taken care of. Would stay there again if given the opportunity! Truly an experience I will never forget.

title: Very stylish downtown hotel
desc: We stayed at the Regent in Singapore as part of our pre-cruise arrangement, and it was simply a perfect stay. All the decorations at the hotel are very stylish and really hide how big the building really is, until you look up to the roof of the truly impressive lobby. Our room was also great, very comfy bed, large marble bathroom, and a functional office desk. Orchard Road with countless shopping malls and restaurants is just around the corner and, maybe best of all, the breakfast was nothing but fantastic!

title: Absolutely terrific staff!
desc: We have tried to make staying at Four Seasons Hotels and Resorts kind of a family tradition, not for loyalty programmes obviously, not even for the amazing luxury or quality of everything, from rooms to restaurants and so on, but for the personalised, friendly irreproachable service that characterises this chain... And The Regent hotel, as part of the Four Seasons family, certainly is doing a great job... It is a rather old hotel, that could use a renovation, but the history, the location, and especially the people working here make it a memorable experience. Our infant daughter got sick during our stay here, and we have received every support possible above and beyond, from scheduling a doctor's appointment, to tea for her, to the best wishes of the staff. Keep it up, great

title: Very nice but not so good service
desc: When we arrive the hotel it seams ok. I had a problem with booking and all they said was that I have to talk with booking.... i don t think is the proper way of dealing with it. The room had a strange smell, and it was a old room with some paintings, not so well done. I must confess I prefer new rooms. To expensive for what you get. The location is not so good.

title: Great staff and a very comfortable stay
desc: The regent singapore Situated in one of the most prime and heart of singapore, this beautiful property is an architectural art piece. The hotel staff is humble and poilte . The hotel has 3 4 different cusinie themed restraunt my favourite being the cute little bakery called DOLCETTO BY BASILICO offering tastiest parfaits and macaroons. They also have a very good gym and pool facilities to burn your holiday calories. For tourists this hotels location comes as as a bonus point with orchard street being at a walking distance or one can even take the bus from the bus stop right in front of the hotel. And the coolest feature I have come across at any hotel is that this HOTEL offers a phone for your entire stay which is free 4g internet and unlimited calling. And also has tickets

title: Love the Regent Singapore...
desc: From the moment we checked in we felt very relaxed at the Regent. Our suite was very spacious and the location is perfect for exploring Singapore, close to the beautiful Botanical Gardens. Thanks for your friendly service. We really enjoyed our stay.

title: Old luxury
desc: The lobby is huge and beautiful, but you can’t use elevator without a card, which was inconvenient. On our floor there was a smell of mold. No fan in the bathroom, and after shower you cant breathe or see anything. Old air conditioning system. And you can’t open a window! I hate hotels, where you can’t get fresh air!

title: Executive Hotel Stay, Did not want to Leave!
desc: 7 night stay Executive Suite Room, loved the room! Each room is cleaned and INSPECTED before we were allowed to check in. Room included a balcony outside bedroom and living room. We had lunch in the Basilico restaurant. WOW what a spread, We chose the lunch buffet and loved the hot counter which included pasta, cut meats, soups, brick oven pizza. Center was fresh fruits, salads, seafood, juices, cheeses, and specialty meats. Opposite counter of desserts, fresh breads, and pastries. All high quality food and delicious. We met Andy, Manager of Basilico and most impressed with this restaurant. Andy was so helpful and reserved us table for their sunday brunch with some Singapore friends.Lalaing was our friendly host to seat us, and serviced by our friendliest waitress, Malini.

title: Great Service every single step
desc: Dear Regent Singapore Team, My Fiancé Mr.Heng & I, Courtney went to Regent Singapore for wedding information & site inspection. We visited all 5 star hotels before and the last one we decided to go to Regent Hotel. I know that wedding or catering sales are not working on weekends, however what I want to say is " Thank You " to your staff (a man standing in the lobby, sorry I didn't notice his name but I guess he is mixed nationality) He tried to check and call if there's anybody can assist us properly. And yes the Banquet Manager, Mr Arthur Low was really helpful which was beyond our expectation. He showed us all the function rooms plus the restaurant where we could have the Solemnisation event. We could say that we have decided to choose your hotel for one of our big day

title: Very good hotel but with surprisingly small swimming pool
desc: I stayed at the Regent hotel a week for work. Very good rooms, excellent food globally very good service. But for five stars and particularly for a Four seasons hotel, this swimming pool is very small and poorly maintained, located under the huge noise of generators or air conditioners.

title: Amazing hotel
desc: I stayed at the Regent for a business trip, and it was an amazing stay. The room is big, with a very large bathroom. The complimentary wifi is fast, but there is a faster wifi for a fee if you need. The breakfast buffet is lavish, with all kinds of different foods. I would describe it as "East meets West" in terms of the variety of options. The staff are incredibly nice and helpful. The Basilico restaurant (the only one I went to) has very nice Italian food. The fitness center is OK, and the pool although small, is adequate.

title: Great service and Quiet in the heart of the city!
desc: Between the upgrade to the minister's suite to give us room for our young child and infant, baby amenities, and a special dessert treat welcome for our son celebrating his birthday, the personal touches from the Regent made us want to stay here again. They prioritized our early check in as we have a 15 month old (ready by 10 am day of) and even offered babysitting while we ate breakfast. The location is walking distance from the heart of Orchard shopping, without all the noise that you would expect for being so close by! A Four Seasons property never disappoints - would recommend this property to friends!!

title: It did not quite work out this time!
desc: As a regular traveller to Singapore I have tried a number of different hotels in an attempt to find one that suited on a number of fronts. Last year I stayed in a Club Room at the Regent Four Seasons Hotel and was not disappointed. This year, I was accompanied by my wife and booked a Club Room at the hotel. The first problem we faced was that the room had an adjoining door and the noise leakage from the guest in the next room was high. The Club Manager, Cristy Mejico, was very understanding and made every effort to find an alternative room but this did not prove possible. The next problem we faced was a small of damp in the living room area. We never found out the reason for the smell but we were informed that the hotel was pet-friendly - accidents can happen and the hotel would

title: Wonderful holiday
desc: We stayed at the Regent hotel for one week, and our stay couldn’t have been more perfect. The hotel is beautiful, and the staff are outstanding, going the extra mile to make you feel special. We felt so welcome. The staff are very knowledgable about Singapore, and always gave us advice on where to go and how to get to places. There is a bus stop on the road directly outside, which takes you straight to the centre, and if you by an ez-link travel card, the trip is about 10 cents! The botanical gardens are a short walk from the hotel, which is lovely. The rooms are clean and the breakfast brilliant. The Manhattan bar in the hotel is amazing. We had a perfect holiday and will definitely choose this hotel again when we come back to Singapore.

title: Disappointing
desc: For a luxury hotel that refers to itself as a Four Seasons hotel I found a number of short comings. For the positives, location is great and staff are very friendly and professional. Lobby area is impressive and choice of bars and restaurants is great. The Manhattan bar is a favourite. However, the rooms are disappointing. Bathrooms are very small (not luxury at all). Rooms need refreshing (scuff marks everywhere and they look dated). Sound proofing is terrible (can hear when surrounding rooms use the shower very loudly). Overall, it’s not good value for money based on the rooms.

title: Best Choice
desc: One day business trip and I decided to stay at the regent. Everything I wanted from the trip 1) check in - quick. Within 5 minutes of walking in I was in my room 2) knew my history at hotel and was upgraded to a suite 3) everything worked in the room 4) f&b outlets all great. Manhattan exceptional 5) checkout - fast 6) Close orchard Highly recommend this hotel. The difference here are the professionalism of the staff Definitely going back!

title: Needs improvement
desc: There are lots of positives about this hotel including a welcoming lobby, very efficient check in staff and concierge, good bars and coffee shop and decent location. It's a 5 min walk from Orchard Road and the hotel is also well served by taxis and bus 36. However, the pool area is in serious need of improvement, it is located outdoor with a very dated decor and I couldn't find any staff member there. The rooms are ok albeit bathrooms need updating. Complementary water is provided everyday and the minibar is reasonably priced. We stayed for two nights and our room wasn't cleaned one of the days even though we asked them to do it after 1 pm since we were running late in the morning when the cleaner came. We found a note upon returning to the hotel at 7 pm asking us to book

title: Brilliant
desc: Plus Check in was quick and friendly. Room was great for 2 adults and 2 kids. Poolside was lovely Breakfast was excellent - fluffiest pancakes and crispiest bacon. Concierge was excellent. Star plus The complimentary smart phone with internet access and free phone calls to 10 countries was a pleasant surprise. One annoying feature Only hotel in 12 years of travelling where I had to pay extra for kids breakfast. Not bank breaking just annoying.

title: Amazing Regent
desc: Where do I start? Been to Regent 5 times and every time it's been a pleasure to stay there. Amazing staff, great facilities - Baslico and Manhattan Bar. Very polite team of staff ever ready to assist.

title: Understated Luxury
desc: From the time you enter, there is definitely a feeling of understated luxury. Deep reddish brown marble give the public areas a veery rich feeling. Service is very professional. Rooms are comfortable and well appointed. Also, free international calls from rooms - great touch. One negative is location. It is located away from central Singapore in an area dominated with embassies.

title: Outstanding service
desc: A large family group booked out a number of rooms in The Regent for a family celebration to be held in the Basilico Room. The rooms are elegant and the service in the hotel is outstanding with an real attention to detail. Nappies and other items fit the baby were put in the cot, cleaners for my glasses - literally everything we asked for or they anticipated we would need was provided with a smile. Most impressive hotel - would definitely stay here again. The Sunday Brunch in the Basilico Room is something everyone should do once - worth going to Singapore for like we did!

title: Excellent Regent Club Experience!
desc: Our second stay at this hotel and this time, we decided to treat ourselves by including booking for the Regent Club. This option allowed us to have breakfast either at the main restaurant Basilico or in the club as well as refreshments all day in the club with canapes and drinks early evening. Again we were very impressed with the professional as well as the very friendly service from all staff but particularly from the Club staff. Our room was spacious and comfortable with a turndown service every evening. Breakfast whether in the club or at the Basilico was excellent with more choice at the latter and more peaceful setting in the club. The 4G phone that they provide is also very useful to navigate around Singapore.

title: Pictures Dont Justice!
desc: This is a stunning hotel and believe me pictures do not do justice just how stunning this hotel is! It has a beautiful lounge, with beautiful classy views! I loved going up and down the lift to see the little fountains and chandeliers! The rooms arent as beautiful as the entrance area but they are definitely 5*, very clean with beautiful modern en suite. I have always stayed at 5* hotels and I believe this hotel beats them. Staff are lovely however expensive for breakfast and not much option for vegetarian and they do not serve halal. However, you can easily find halal places in Singapore without much effort. It is a few minutes walk from Tanglin Mall, Orchard Road shops and to the Bus Stop for catching hop on and hop off buses. You can use google maps easily in Singapore. We

title: Fabulous hotel
desc: I recently had a large family gathering at The Regent hotel for a birthday celebration. None of us are from Singapore and we all stayed at The Regent. The hotel staff were very helpful and knew that we were a group. We had the birthday celebration at Basilico's Restaurant and the whole experience was totally wonderful. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. Things like having a birthday cake in our room upon arrival (and again on the actual birthday) to entertaining the one year old in our group during Brunch to greeting us all by name are the hallmarks of a great hotel. The rooms are always impeccably clean, the staff very friendly and helpful and the food in all their restaurants is excellent including room service. The location of the hotel is perfect as it

title: Excellent Hotel
desc: We stayed here in Dec for 3 days and went back 14-18 March booked 2 connected rooms for the family. Got to say this hotel never fails to please. Excellent service, great breakfast, wonderful location, well appointed rooms, great lobby and common areas. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Singapore. We will be sure to return.

title: Beautiful hotel in great location
desc: We stayed at the Regent for 3 nights post cruise. This was our first visit to Singapore and we were not disappointed. The hotel is around $18 from the cruise terminal and took about 15-20 mins in the taxi. It is in a good location 5 min walk from the top end of Orchard Road. We made use of the hop on hop off bus which has a stop a couple of mins walk from the hotel. The interior is beautiful and thoroughly clean. We stayed on a b&b basis and the breakfast had a good choice to suit lots of diets. The staff were excellent and couldn’t do enough to assist us. If we visit again we would love to return here.

title: Excellent hotel
